00013 /* The maximum number of buffers that can be dispatched from the 
00014    output/dma queue. Set to 64 assuming 1K buffers in DROQ and the fact that 
00015    max packet size from DROQ is 64K. */
00016 #define    MAX_RECV_BUFS    64
00017 
00018 /* Allocated using malloc etc. */
00019 #define    OCT_RECV_BUF_TYPE_1   OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_1
00020 
00021 /* Is a skb or similar. */
00022 #define    OCT_RECV_BUF_TYPE_2   OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_2
00023 
00024 
00025 /** Receive Packet format used when dispatching output queue packets
00026     with non-raw opcodes.
00027     The received packet will be sent to the upper layers using this
00028     structure which is passed as a parameter to the dispatch function 
00029 */
00030 typedef struct {
00031 
00032   /**  Number of buffers in this received packet */
00033    uint16_t               buffer_count;
00034  
00035   /** Id of the device that is sending the packet up */
00036    uint8_t                octeon_id;
00037 
00038   /** The type of buffer contained in the buffer ptr's for this recv pkt. */
00039    uint8_t                buf_type;
00040 
00041   /** Length of data in the packet buffer */
00042    uint32_t               length;
00043 
00044   /** The response header */
00045    octeon_resp_hdr_t      resp_hdr;
00046 
00047   /** Pointer to the OS-specific packet buffer */
00048    void                  *buffer_ptr[MAX_RECV_BUFS]; 
00049 
00050   /** Size of the buffers pointed to by ptr's in buffer_ptr */
00051    uint32_t               buffer_size[MAX_RECV_BUFS];
00052 
00053 } octeon_recv_pkt_t;
00054  
00055 
00056 #define OCT_RECV_PKT_SIZE    (sizeof(octeon_recv_pkt_t))
00057 
00058 
00059 
00060 /** The first parameter of a dispatch function.
00061     For a raw mode opcode, the driver dispatches with the device 
00062     pointer in this structure. 
00063     For non-raw mode opcode, the driver dispatches the recv_pkt_t
00064     created to contain the buffers with data received from Octeon.
00065     ---------------------
00066     |     *recv_pkt ----|---
00067     |-------------------|   |
00068     | 0 or more bytes   |   |
00069     | reserved by driver|   |
00070     |-------------------|<-/
00071     | octeon_recv_pkt_t |
00072     |                   |
00073     |___________________|
00074 */
00075 typedef struct {
00076     void                     *rsvd;
00077     octeon_recv_pkt_t        *recv_pkt;
00078 } octeon_recv_info_t;
00079 
00080 #define  OCT_RECV_INFO_SIZE    (sizeof(octeon_recv_info_t))
00081 
00082 
00083 typedef   int(* octeon_dispatch_fn_t)(octeon_recv_info_t *, void *);
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087 #define POLL_EVENT_INTR_ARRIVED  1
00088 #define POLL_EVENT_PROCESS_PKTS  2
00089 #define POLL_EVENT_ENABLE_INTR   3
00090 
00091 /** Used by NIC module to register packet handler and to get device
00092   * information for each octeon device.
00093   */
00094 typedef struct {
00095     /** This registered function will be called by the driver with
00096         the octeon id, pointer to buffer from droq and length of 
00097         data in the buffer. The response header gives the port 
00098         number to the caller.  Function pointer is set by caller.  */
00099     void       (*fptr)(int, void *, uint32_t, octeon_resp_hdr_t *);
00100 
00101     /* This function will be called by the driver for all NAPI related
00102        events. The first param is the octeon id. The second param is the
00103        output queue number. The third is the NAPI event that occurred. */
00104     void       (*napi_fn)(int, int, int );
00105 
00106     int        poll_mode;
00107 
00108     /** Flag indicating if the DROQ handler should drop packets that
00109         it cannot handle in one iteration. Set by caller. */
00110     int        drop_on_max;
00111 
00112     uint16_t   op_mask;
00113 
00114     uint16_t   op_major;
00115 
00116 } octeon_droq_ops_t;
00117 
00118 
00119 
00120 
00121 
00122 /** Structure passed by kernel application when registering a module with
00123     the driver. */
00124 typedef struct {
00125 
00126     /* Application type for which handler is being registered. */
00127     uint32_t   app_type;
00128 
00129     /* Call this routine to perform add-on module related setup activities
00130        when a octeon device is being initialized.
00131      */
00132     int   (*startptr)(int, void *);
00133 
00134     /* Call this routine to perform add-on module related reset activities
00135        when a octeon device is being reset.
00136      */
00137     int   (*resetptr)(int, void *);
00138 
00139     /* Call this routine to perform add-on module related shutdown 
00140        activities when a octeon device is being removed or the driver is 
00141        being unloaded.
00142          */
00143     int   (*stopptr)(int, void *);
00144 
00145 } octeon_module_handler_t;
00146

00148 
00149 /** Used by CNTQ module to register DMA queue interrupt handler, tasklets
00150   * and statistics routines for each octeon device.
00151   */
00152 typedef struct {
00153 
00154     /** Tasklet to be scheduled for CNTQ bottom half processing. */
00155     void      (*bh)(unsigned long);
00156 
00157     /** Interrupt Handler for DMA Queue interrupts. */
00158     int       (*intr_handler)(void  *, uint64_t);
00159 
00160     /** Read DMA Counter Queue and DDOQ list statistics into a structure */
00161     int       (* read_statsb)(int, oct_stats_t *);
00162 
00163     /** Format and print DMA Counter Queue and DDOQ list statistics into a buffer */
00164     int       (* read_stats)(int, char *);
00165 
00166 } octeon_dma_ops_t;
00167

00170 /** Return value for a poll function. The driver will continue scheduling the
00171     poll function as long as the function returns OCT_POLL_FN_CONTINUE. */
00172 typedef enum {
00173     OCT_POLL_FN_CONTINUE     = 0,
00174     OCT_POLL_FN_FINISHED     = 1,
00175     OCT_POLL_FN_ERROR        = 2,
00176     OCT_POLL_FN_REGISTERED   = 3, /* Used internally by driver */
00177     OCT_POLL_FN_UNREGISTERED = 4  /* Used internally by driver */
00178 } oct_poll_fn_status_t;
00179 
00180 
00181 
00182 typedef   oct_poll_fn_status_t (* octeon_poll_fn_t)(void *, unsigned long);
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186 
00187 /** Structure passed by kernel application when registering a poll function with
00188     the driver. */
00189 typedef struct {
00190 
00191     /** Pointer to Poll function to be called by the poll thread. */
00192     octeon_poll_fn_t   fn;
00193 
00194     /** The function argument to be passed to the poll function when it
00195         is scheduled by the poll thread. */
00196     unsigned long      fn_arg;
00197 
00198     /** The scheduling interval in timer ticks that the poll function
00199         should be scheduled by the poll thread */
00200     int                ticks;
00201 
00202     /** A character string to identify this poll function. */
00203     char               name[80];
00204 
00205     /** Reserved for Driver use. Do not set this field */
00206     uint32_t           rsvd;
00207 
00208 } octeon_poll_ops_t;

00216 /**   Register a dispatch function for a opcode. The driver will call 
00217  *    this dispatch function when it receives a packet with the given
00218  *    opcode in its output queues along with the user specified argument.
00219  *    @param  octeon_id  - the octeon device to register with.
00220  *    @param  opcode     - the opcode for which the dispatch will be registered.
00221  *    @param  fn         - the dispatch function.
00222  *    @param  fn_arg     - user specified that will be passed along with the
00223  *                         dispatch function by the driver.
00224  *    @return Success: 0; Failure: 1
00225  */
00226 uint32_t octeon_register_dispatch_fn(uint32_t            octeon_id, 
00227                                    octeon_opcode_t       opcode,
00228                                    octeon_dispatch_fn_t  fn,
00229                                    void                  *fn_arg);
00230 
00231 
00232 /**  Remove registration for an opcode. This will delete the mapping for
00233  *   an opcode. The dispatch function will be unregistered and will no
00234  *   longer be called if a packet with the opcode arrives in the driver
00235  *   output queues.
00236  *   @param  octeon_id  -  the octeon device to unregister from.
00237  *   @param  opcode     -  the opcode to be unregistered.
00238  *
00239  *   @return Success: 0; Failure: 1
00240  */
00241 uint32_t octeon_unregister_dispatch_fn(uint32_t       octeon_id,
00242                                      octeon_opcode_t  opcode);

00330 
00331 /** Register a change in droq operations. The ops field has a pointer to a
00332   * function which will called by the DROQ handler for all packets arriving
00333   * on output queues given by q_no irrespective of the type of packet.
00334   * The ops field also has a flag which if set tells the DROQ handler to 
00335   * drop packets if it receives more than what it can process in one 
00336   * invocation of the handler.
00337   * @param octeon_id - octeon device id
00338   * @param q_no      - octeon output queue number (0 <= q_no <= MAX_OCTEON_DROQ-1
00339   * @param ops       - the droq_ops settings for this queue
00340   * @return          - 0 on success, -ENODEV or -EINVAL on error.
00341   */ 
00342 int
00343 octeon_register_droq_ops(int octeon_id, int q_no, octeon_droq_ops_t  *ops);
00344 
00345 
00346 
00347 
00348 /** Resets the function pointer and flag settings made by
00349   * octeon_register_droq_ops(). After this routine is called, the DROQ handler
00350   * will lookup dispatch function for each arriving packet on the output queue
00351   * given by q_no.
00352   * @param octeon_id - octeon device id
00353   * @param q_no      - octeon output queue number (0 <= q_no <= MAX_OCTEON_DROQ-1
00354   * @return          - 0 on success, -ENODEV or -EINVAL on error.
00355   */
00356 int
00357 octeon_unregister_droq_ops(int octeon_id, int q_no );
00358

00360 
00361 
00362 /** Register module handler functions to be called by the octeon base driver
00363  * when a octeon device is being initialized. The "start" function in the
00364  * handler may be called in this function call's context if this function is
00365  * called after a octeon device was initialized. The "app_type" field 
00366  * is checked by the base module against the application type given by the
00367  * core application in its start indicator. If it matches, the base module
00368  * calls the start handler for that octeon device.
00369  * @param handler - structure with "start" and "stop" routines and app type. 
00370  * @return 0 on success, -EINVAL if the handler arguments are invalid or if
00371  *         a handler was already registered; -ENOMEM if no space is available
00372  *         to add this handler.
00373  */
00374 int
00375 octeon_register_module_handler(octeon_module_handler_t  *handler);
00376 
00377 
00378 
00379 
00380 /** Called by a module when it is being unloaded to unregister start
00381  * and stop functions. The "stop" function will be called in this function
00382  * call's context. The "stop" routine will also be called if the octeon device
00383  * if being removed (due to a hot-swap operation).
00384  * @param app_type - the handler for this applicatin type should be removed.
00385  * @return 0 on success; -ENODEV if no handler was found for the app_type.
00386  */
00387 int
00388 octeon_unregister_module_handler(uint32_t  app_type);
00389 
00390 
00391 int
00392 octeon_reset_oq_bufsize(int octeon_id, int q_no, int newsize);
00393 
00394 
00395 /** Register a poll function with the driver. The "ops" parameter
00396  *  points to a octeon_poll_ops_t structure that holds a pointer to the poll
00397  *  function, an optional argument that the driver should call if the poll
00398  *  function is called and the time interval in ticks that the poll function
00399  *  should be called.
00400  *  @param oct_id - octeon device id
00401  *  @param ops    - pointer to a structure with the poll function details.
00402  *  @return 0 on success; -ENODEV, -EINVAL or -ENOMEM on failure.
00403  */
00404 int
00405 octeon_register_poll_fn(int oct_id, octeon_poll_ops_t  *ops);
00406 
00407 
00408 /** Unregister a poll function. The fn and fn_arg used when
00409     octeon_register_poll_fn() was called is passed as arguments to
00410  *  uniquely identify the instance of the poll function to be unregistered.
00411  *  @param oct_id - octeon device id
00412  *  @param fn     - the poll function to be unregistered.
00413  *  @param fn_arg - the poll function argument.
00414  *  @return 0 on success; -ENODEV on failure.
00415  */
00416 int
00417 octeon_unregister_poll_fn(int oct_id, octeon_poll_fn_t   fn,
00418                         unsigned long  fn_arg);
